summary:
Jordan, officially the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, is a West Asian country with a rich history. It borders Syria, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Israel, and the Palestinian territories. The Jordan River and the Dead Sea mark its western border. Amman, the capital, is the Levant's largest city.

Humans have lived there since ancient times, with kingdoms like Ammon, Moab, and Edom emerging in the Bronze Age. The Arab Nabataeans ruled in the BC era. Later, it was part of many empires. After World War I, it became the Emirate of Transjordan and gained independence in 1946.

Jordan is mostly Sunni Muslim, with a small Christian population. It has welcomed refugees from nearby conflicts, including Palestinians and Syrians. As a constitutional monarchy, Jordan is a member of the Arab League and has a growing economy, attracting tourists and medical visitors.
title: Jordan
